titleStmt.title: Herman Hadlan v. William Billings. Writ

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Herman Hadlan v. William Billings. Writ
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.p: In the District Court holding terms at Olympia for Mason and Thurston Counties:
In the matter of Herman Hadlan for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

Upon wording and filing the petition of Herman Hadlan, duly signed and verified by him, whereby it appears that he is illegally imprisoned and restrained of his liberty by D.M. Brown Marshall of the City of Olympia County of Thurston Territory of Washington and stating wherein the alleged illegality consists: from which it appears to me that a writ of Habeas Corpus ought to issue. It is ordered that a writ of Habeas Corpus issue out of and under the seal of the Dis- trict Court of the second Judicial District of Wash- ington Territory holding terms at Olympia, directed to the said D.M. Brown, Marshall as afore- said commanding hereinto for the body of the said Herman Hadlan before me in the Court room of said Court, at the City of Olympia County of Thurston Territory of Washington, on the second day of July A.D. 1884 at the hour of three o'clock P.M. of said day, to do and receive what shall then and there be considered concerning the said petitoner Herman Hadlan: together with the time and cause of his detention, and that you, have then and there the said writ.
Dated July 2nd 1884 John P. Hoyt Judge of said Court
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss
I R.G. O'Bruin, clerk of said Court hereby certify the foregoing to be a true copy of the order in said matter made and centered now of word in my office
Witness my hand and the seal of said Court this July 2, 1884 R.G. O'Bruin Clerk
Territory of Washington County of Thurston } ss
I hereby ceritfy that the above and foregoing is a true copy of the now in my hands for service.
William Billings Sheriff of Thurston County W.T. July 2nd 1884 By R.P. Shocroft Deputy
Received and Filed Jul 2 1884 R.G. O'Bruin Clerk
Territory of Washington for County of Thurston

I, D.M. Brown Marshall of the City of Olympia do hereby return to the that in obedience thereto I have Court the body of said Herman Hadlan which I hold and justify my holding thereof by return of the causes and commitment
D.M. Brown Marshall of the City of Olympia
